lead_paragraph: The police should not use stun guns on people who try to evade custody but pose no safety risk to the officers or others, a federal appeals court decided in a ruling that will affect five states.

headline.print_headline: Virginia: Appeals Panel Sets Limits on Stun Gun Use
headline.main: Virginia: Appeals Panel Sets Limits on Stun Gun Use

snippet: The police should not use stun guns on people who try to evade custody but pose no safety risk to the officers or others, a federal appeals court decided in a ruling that will affect five states.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Virginia limits use of stun guns by police officers on people evading custody who pose no safety risk to officers or public; Fourth Circuit court's ruling is binding in North Carolina, South Carolina, West Virginia, Maryland and Virginia.
